title: Apple macOS AMDRadeonX4000_AMDSIGLContext RsrcAndXorByteFlag Out-Of-Bounds Read Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Apple macOS. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the RsrcAndXorByteFlag method of the AMDRadeonX4000_AMDAccelSharedUserClient class. TThe issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a read past the end of an allocated data structure. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to escalate privileges to the level of the kernel.
addtionnal_details: Apple has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT210348
timeline:
2019-04-03 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2019-07-24 - Coordinated public release of advisory
credit: Lilang Wu and Moony Li of TrendMicro Mobile Security Research Team
